topic.title: cf-mgmt Tool Example: Add a Service to an Existing Cluster

body.p: This example demonstrates how to add a MySQL service to a cluster that already exists.

ol.li: The code block provided below is an example of the bootstrap.yml text file that the cf-mgmt tool can use to import parameter values. To add an existing Trove database, include a value for the --database-instance-id parameter.file version: 1.2 constructor-image-name: HP Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Installer 1.2.0.282 constructor-flavor: standard.xsmall seed-node-image-name: HP Helion Development Platform - Application Lifecycle Service Seed Node 1.2.0.282 core-flavor: standard.medium cluster-title: <My Cluster Title> cluster-prefix: <My Cluster Prefix> services-on-core: false flavor: standard.medium

Run the following set of commands. cf-mgmt.exe ^ --os-auth-url <auth-url> ^ --os-username <username> ^ --os-password <password> ^ --os-tenant-id <id> ^ --os-tenant-name "<tenant-name>" ^ --os-region-name "<region-name>" ^ add-service mysql ^ --keypair-name <keypair name> ^ --load bootstrap_service.yml ^
